Name: Chaos Breath
Description:
Your Breath Weapon trait is replaced with the following trait:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8+ your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save they take 1d4 fire, lightning, poison, acid and cold damage, or half as much on a successful save. This damage increases to 1d6 at 5th level, 1d8 at 11th level and 1d12 at 17th level.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Name: Knight of Chaos
Description: Whenever you take fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold damage you may use your reaction to make a weapon attack against a target other than the source of the damage. If you hit you deal an additional 1d4 damage of the damage that you took. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Elemental Rest
Prerequisite: No other Rest Traits and 10+ piety with Tiamat
Description: After a short rest you and any creature of your choice become resistant to one of the following damage types: fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold until they finish their next short rest.

Name: Frightening Breaths
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever a creature fails their saving throw against your Breath Weapon by 5 or more they become frightened of you for the next minute. They may repeat their saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

Name: Gold Hoarder
Description: For every 1000 gold pieces worth of coins you have in your possession, you gain a +1 bonus to Charisma ability checks, to a maximum of your Wisdom modifier.

Name: Knight of Flame
Description: The damage from your Warrior of Flame trait increases to 3d6. Additionally you gain an aura of heat around you. Whenever a creature comes within 10 feet of you, you may use your reaction to deal fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus to them. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all uses on a long rest.

Name: Red Rest
Description: Your evil emanates from you while you rest. Any celestial and good aligned creature in a 300 foot emination around you have their maximum hit points lowered by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier. As soon as the creature leaves the emination the reduction ends. The emination dissapears if you leave the terrain type you had your rest in.

Name: Extreme Heat
Description: Once per long rest when you deal fire damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

Name: Furnaced Fire
Description: Whenever you deal fire damage to a creature you may choose to apply the effect of Heat Metal to a metal object they are wearing or have on them too. The effect lasts until the start of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Power from Destruction
Description: At the end of your turn you may count the total number of damage dice you dealt. You regain hit points equal to this amount. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Knight of Spores
Prerequisite:
{@optfeature Warrior of Spores|chromaticorenth},
Tier 1 Fey Trait
Description: The damage from your Warrior of Spores trait increases to 2d8 and the radius increases by 10 feet to a total of 20 feet. Additionally the creatures become frightened of you and one another. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a failure.

Name: Deep Rest
Prerequisite: No other Rest Traits and a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait
Description: Spores flit through the air around you as you take a short rest. Throughout the next day you may communicate telepahtically with anyone within 300 feet of you that you share a language with.

Name: Knight of Storm
Description: Your attacks become charged. Whenever you hit a creature with an attack roll you may also use your reaction to deal additional lightning damage equal to your Wisdom modifier to a creature within 5 feet of them.

Name: Nightmare Spores
Prerequisite: A tier 1 Fey Orenth trait, Deep Dragonborn.
Description: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Any creature in the cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns. You may use this feature once per Long Rest.

Name: Zapping Breath
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals Lightning damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, instead of breathing your breath in a straight line you may instead target any number of creatures, but the total distance the lightning travels can’t supercede the length of your breath weapon.

Name: Blue Rest
Description: During a short rest small illusions start appearing around you to dissuade unwanted visitors. These illusions are equivalent to up to 1 casting of Major Image and a number of castings of the silent image spell equal to your Wisdom modifier within 300 feet of you, moving with you as you travel, using your Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. You determine the look of the illusions during the short rest and cannot change them throughout the day. They dissapear when a creature figures out it is an illusion or when you start your next short rest.

Name: Muscle Spasm
Description: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature you can immediately force it to use its reaction to make a melee attack against a random creature within its reach. You can use ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier and you regain all expended uses on a long rest.

Name: Overcharged
Description: Once per long rest when you deal lightning damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

Name: Knight of Water
Description: Your swimming speed increases by an additional 15 feet. Additionally while underwater your attacks deal an additional 1d6 acid damage.

Name: Black Rest
Description: The water fouls in the area around where you are taking a short rest. Whenever a creature within 300 feet of you starts its turn touching natural water it takes 1d6 acid damage. If the creature is fully submerged it takes 2d6 acid damage. You and any creatures of your choice are immune to this effect. The effect ends when you start your next short rest or leave the terrain type you had your short rest in.

Name: Coverd in Lichens
Description: Lichens are slowly growing on you. After every short rest five more grow, to a maximum of 5 times your level. Whenever you take acid, necrotic or radiant damage you may choose to have the lichens absorb the damage, reducing the damage by the number of lichens you used. Whenever you take poison damage you lose 5 lichens.

Name: Pure Acid
Description: Once per long rest when you deal acid damage treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

Name: The Winds are on my Side.
Description: You get the benefits of the {@optfeature Grinding Halt|ingensorenth} Orenth Trait. Whenever you use the feature you may make the creature that pushed you make the saving throw also. On a failure they are pushed the distance away from you instead. Any other effects that result from the saving throw still only apply to you.

Name: Fungal Fear
Prerequisite: Exclusive and a tier 1 Fey Orenth trait
Description: You get the benefits of the {@optfeature Fearsome Accuracy|ingensorenth} trait. Additionally whenever you hit a creature at the edge of your range you deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage to them.

Name: Elemental Fighting Expert
Description: If you have advantage on the attack roll and you hit, you may deal an additional 1d4 damage. The damage type of this extra damage can either be fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold (choose when you pick this trait).

Name: Elemental Deflection
Description: You gain the benefits of the {@optfeature Deflective Weapons|ingensorenth} Orenth trait. Whenever you make a saving throw to avoid taking Elemental Damage, you may also use your reaction to roll the dice and add it to your saving throw.

Name: Knight of Wind
Description: The distance you can push a creature using your Warrior of Wind trait increases by 15 feet, and you may push the creature up to 20 feet vertically as well.

Name: White Rest
Description: Strong winds surround your place of rest. While you are taking a short rest, strong winds blow outward from your resting place. Any creature within 300 feet of where you are taking your rest that attempts to come closer to you must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved. You and any creature of your choice are immune to this effect.

Name: Biting cold
Description: Once per long rest when you deal cold damage treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

Name: Knight of Wood
Description: The damage from your Warrior of Wood trait increases to 1d6. Additionally you have advantage on attack rolls against poisoned creatures.

Name: Vine Grapple
Description: When you grapple a creature you may choose to restrain them too until the end of the grapple. While the grapple persists you also have a speed of 0. You may grapple a creature in this way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Poisonous Cloud
Description: You gain an additional use of your Breath weapon. Additionally, instead of breathing your breath in a straight line you can choose to spit out a poisonous cloud instead. Any creature within 10 feet of a point you can see within 60 feet becomes the target on your breath weapon.

Name: Green Rest
Description: Vegetation grows wild around where you take your short rest. In a 300 foot emination around you, plants become difficult terrain. Additionally as an action you may attempt to grapple a creature that is in this difficult terrain, using your Wisdom in place of Strength for the attack roll and save DC. These effects end as soon as you start a new short rest, or you leave the terrain you spent your rest in.

Name: Suffering Without End
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a spell that has repeated saving throws to end an effect, you choose to especially torture a single target of the spell. If they fail the initial save they automatically fail all other saving throws.

Name: Evolved Poison
Description: Once per long rest when you deal poison damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

Name: Exhaustive Poison
Description: Whenever you give a creature the poisoned condition, you also give them one level of exhaustion that lasts until the poisoned condition ends.

Name: Control of the Woods
Description: You can cast enlarge/reduce as an action without expending a spellslot as long as you are targetting a plant. You use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability.

Name: Enhanced Chromatic Warding
Description: You may now use your Chromatic Warding ability twice per long rest. Additionally you may deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus whenever you deal damage while your Chromatic Warding is active. You may do this once per turn, and the damage type is the one associated with your ancestry.

Name: Back to Basics
Description: You return to a more primal version of yourself. You get the Pack Tactics feature, granting advantage against enemies while an ally is within 5 feet of the opponent. In addition, you get Sunlight Sensitivity, giving disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom(Perception) checks while you or the target is in direct sunlight.

Name: Spell Defyance
Description:
Your connection to your Orenth has granted you a greater resistance to magic.
You gain advantage on saving throws against spells you currently have prepared and resistance against spells you currently have prepared.

Name: Uneasy Unevennes
Description: Whenever dice are rolled for damage within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to increase or decrease the dice size by one. For example, if the damage is 4d10, you now roll 4d11. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Sun Poisoning
Description: You stare at someone with the sickening intensity of the sun as a bonus action. They must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+proficiency bonus+your Wisdom) or their strength attacks deal half damage for the next minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Careful Thinker
Description: You can decide to take ten times as much time for an ability check as it would normally take. When you make the check you may treat any number rolled lower than a thrice your proficiency bonus as if you rolled a value equal to thrice your proficiency bonus instead. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

Name: Light as Air
Description: You become resistant to fall damage. You can use creatures of your size as mounts.

Name: Rest of Il Fusto
Description: While taking a short rest you channel the healing energy of Il Fusto. Within 300 feet of you Fusto Berries start growing. You can spend 10 minutes to make a DC12 Wisdom (Survival) check. Each creature in the area can attempt this check once. On a success you find 1d4 Fusto berries. You cannot regain more hit points than your level from eating Fusto berries in one day. For the next 24 hours you do not age and you are immune to effects that increase your age.

Name: Elvenier Eyes
Description: You get Expertise in Perception

Name: Wilderness Trance
Description: While taking a short rest out in the wilderness you are able to perform a travel activity. You can perform this activity without leaving your camp for too long.

Name: Fey Mind
Description: You are immune to the charmed condition.

Name: Aura of Strategy
Description: Once per long rest, as an action, you can utter a special command or warning. For the next minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll or a saving throw, the creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand you. This effect ends if you are incapacitated.

Name: Advanced Weird Magic
Description: You may now roll on the {@table Weird magic table|oreorenth} twice and pick which of the two effects you want to make happen. Additionally you regain a use once per short rest.

Name: Annis Hag's Hugs
Description: Whenever you grapple a creature you may also deal bludgeoning damage to the creature at the end of your turns. You deal damage equal to your Strength modifier plus your Charisma modifier.

Name: Green Hag's Voice
Description: You can perfectly replicate any sound you’ve heard before. Additionally you can throw your voice to originate from any point within 60 feet of you.

Name: Sea Hag's Glare
Description:
As a bonus action you may glare at a creature within 15 feet of you that can see you. They must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier), on a failure they become frightened of you for the next minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your glare for the next 24 hours.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Night Hag's Bag
Description: As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points you may trap their soul in your magical bag. As an action you can consume the soul, regaining a number of hit points equal to twice the creature’s CR (rounded up).

Name: Bheur Hag's Graystaff
Description: One quarterstaff of your choice becomes your Graystaff. While you have it on your body you are under the effects of the featherfall spell. Additionally once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you may reduce their speed by 10 feet. Only you can benefit from the benefits of your Graystaff. You may make a different quarterstaff your Graystaff at the end of a long rest.

Name: Photosynthesis
Description: Your skin becomes bright green. You become resistant to radiant damage and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier whenever you start your turn in sunlight.

Name: No reflection
Description: You no longer show up in divination magic and you have no reflection. Additionally, you may use your Charisma instead of your Dexterity whenever you make a Stealth check.

Name: Grabby Goblin Hands
Description: Choose a Light melee weapon you have proficiency with, or your Unarmed Strikes. Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you gain the Hold On condition to the target. The target must be at least one size larger than you.

Name: Moonstone Steps
Prerequisite: The ability to teleport in some way
Description: You can use your movement and bonus action to teleport. You can teleport to any place you would normally be able to move with your movement, ignoring difficult terrain. Creatures can make an opportunity attack against you when you teleport away from them.

Name: Expert Fey Bargainer
Description: Roll 2d6 and 1d4 and consult the [@table Fey Bargain Table|oreorenth}. You gain vulnerability to the first damage type you rolled and resistance to the second, you gain resistance to the damage type you rolled with the d4. If you had resistance to a damage type that you now gained a vulnerability to, they cancel out. Whenever you get a new Orenth trait you can choose to reroll all three.

Name: Minor Magic item Creator
Description: Over the course of a short rest you can turn an item into a common magic item. The item must match the common magic item. You can have one such magic item at a time.

Name: Collaborative Steps
Prerequisite: The ability to teleport in some way
Description: Whenever you teleport you may take one additional willing creature within 5 feet of you with you.

Name: Paths of the Feywild
Description: At the start of your turn remember where you are standing. As a reaction at the end of another creature's turn you may teleport back to this spot. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Momentum Calculation
Description:
After hitting with a weapon attack you may use your reaction to make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against the AC of the creature you hit. On a success your weapon automatically deals max damage and you expend a use of this feature. On a failure nothing happens.
Any smites, sneak attack bonuses, spells or other damage increasing effects are not maximised. But, if for example you have a magical weapon that deals an additional 1d6 fire damage, this would be maximised.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Fortitude Mimicry
Description: As an action you resemble a creature you can see within range a little more. You gain immunity to two conditions they have immunity to of your choice for the next minute. You may use this action a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Singularity Breath
Description:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that failed their saving throw has their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

Name: Shattering Shard Sling
Description: Whenever you hit a creature with a sling attack, you deal an additional 1d4 force damage to the creature you hit and any creature within 5 feet of it.

Name: Planar Disruptor
Description: Once per turn you may deal an additional 1d8 force damage against aberrations fiends, fey, celestials and elementals when you deal damage to such a creature.

Name: Amethyst Spit
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weaon. Additionally, whenever you use your Breath weapon, you may instead choose to spit an exploding amethyst crystal. Any creature within 10 feet of a point you can see within 60 feet becomes the target on your breath weapon.

Name: Flash Forward
Description: Sometimes the future is uncertain, and you are able to steer the course of time into the result you desire. When you or a creature within 30 feet of you rolls damage you may roll twice and pick which one as reaction. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses on a long rest.

Name: Crystal Rest
Description:
Being prepared is important, definitely when you’re preparing for a day of travel. When you start taking a short rest, the DM chooses an omen to send you. The DM will also notify you of the creature type that may cause this effect.
Positive* Something positive is likely to happen the next day.
Negative* Something negative is likely to happen the next day.
Neutral* Nothing necessarily positive or negative is likely to happen the next day. 
Uncertain* Something is likely to happen the next day, but the outcome of the situation can turn out either positive or negative.

Name: Synced Rejuvination
Description: Whenever a monster you can see regains the use of a rechargable ability (by rolling a 5/6 on a d6) you may regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of one of your hit dice + your Intelligence modifier.

Name: Guided by the Stars
Description: Once per long rest you and your party can travel throughout the night without gaining a level of exhaustion. This counts as an additional day of travel and you don't suffer any disadvantages from travelling at night.

Name: Disorienting Breath
Description:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that fails their saving throw is forced to subtract 1d6 from all their attack rolls and ability checks until the end of their next turn.

Name: Emerald Rest
Description: You magically hide yourself during a short rest. Any creature that is unaware of your presence that tries to get within 300 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifer). On a failed save they come no closer and move around your resting area without learning of your presence. On a successful save they continue their original path. This effect ends until you start your next short rest or leave the terrain type that you spent your rest in.

Name: Unseen Step
Description:
Your connection to Emerald dragons has led you to be good at being unheard and unseen. Whenever you take the Hide Action and successfully hide, you can choose to become invisible as a part of that action instead. While invisible you also do not make any sound. Your invisibility ends after one minute or if you take the Magic or Attack action.
You may use this ability once per short rest.

Name: Euphoria Breath
Description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus), or for 1 minute, the target can’t take reactions and must roll a d6at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:
1–4: The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
5–6: The target doesn’t move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success
You may use this ability once per long rest.

Name: Jade Rest
Prerequisite: No other Rest Traits and a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait
Description: Time becomes messy when you take your rest. Any creature that into the 300 foot emination must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failure they must roll on the {@table Messed Up Time Table|oreorenth}, experiencing the effect. Any creatures of your choice that you are aware of are immune to the effect. The effects end as soon as they or you leave the area, or you leave the terrain type that you spent your rest in.

Name: Beguiling Breath
Description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus), or they are charmed by you for one minute. While charmed in this way they cannot lie to you. Undead cannot be immune to this charm.
You may use this ability once per long rest.

Name: Undead Understanding
Description: Whenever an Undead creature tries to attack you it must first succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the undead must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This Ability doesn’t protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If you have attacked the undead it has advantage on its saving throw.

Name: Can't die again
Description: Whenever you fail a saving throw that deals enough damage to reduce you to 0 hit points, you may reroll it.

Name: A bit more dead than alive
Description: Your creature type becomes undead. If damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

Name: Undead Pals
Description: As an action you may choose an undead with a CR equal to or lower than your proficiency bonus that you can see within 30 feet of you. It must see and hear you. If the undead's Intelligence is 11 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the undead must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for an hour. While charmed in this way it becomes non-hostile to your and allies of your choosing. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the effect ends.

Name: Gave you a bit too much
Description: Whenever you heal a creature on your turn you may choose to give them twice the amount of hit points, but you fall unconscious until the start of your next turn.

Name: Wait, I remember you...
Description: You may cast Charm Person a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. When you cast the spell in this way it requires no spell components.

Name: Secrets of the Allip
Description: An Allip has told you part of a great secret that has broken your mind. Whenever you fail a Wisdom, Intelligence or Charisma saving throw, you may choose to succeed instead. However, you do gain a level of exhaustion.

Name: What even is Reality
Description: Whenever a creature has one of the following conditions applied to them you can use your action to change it to one of the others: Deafened, Blinded, Frightened, or Restrained. The duration and additional effects still apply. You may do this once per long rest.

Name: Loosely bound Soul
Description: Once per long rest when you become incapacitated you can attempt to possess a creature within 30 feet of you. The creature must have a level equal to yours or a CR equal to or less than half your level rounded down. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failure, you have full control over them for one minute or until your incapacitated condition ends or your body dies.

Name: Debilitating Breath
Description:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus) or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.
You may use this ability once per long rest.

Name: Physical Prowess Estimation
Description:
As a bonus action you can observe the physiology of a creature to get an estimate of their physical state. Make an Intelligence (Medicine) check against their Dexterity score. On a success you learn which of their physical ability scores is the highest and which is the lowest, and whether they have proficiency in any physical saving throws.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Sapphire Zoologist
Description: As a bonus action you may learn the creature type of a creature you can see. This ability is not able to detect the original creature type of a creature altered by magic (such as polymorph or magic aura).

Name: Sapphire Rest
Description: During a short rest, creatures and plants around you become luminescent. Within 300 feet of you any plant or animal sheds dim light in a 20 foot radius that only you and your allies can see. If a creature enters this dim light, the animals and plants shed bright light for you and your allies instead. This effect ends when you leave the terrain type that you took your short rest in, or you start a new short rest.

Name: Can't be outmatched
Description:
Whenever you are fighting a creature you may use your bonus action to measure your own physical ability against theirs. Choose one of the following attributes: 
Strength: If the creature's strength score is higher than yours, your Strength modifier increases by 1 for the next minute. If theirs is lower nothing happens. 
Armor Class: If the creature's Armor Class is higher than yours, your armor class increases by 2 for the next minute. If theirs is lower nothing happens. 
Number of hit dice: If you have fewer total hit dice than the creature you may immediately roll one of your hit dice and add your Constitution modifier, regaining this many hit points. You don't spend any hit dice when using this ability. If your total hit dice are lower than theirs nothing happens. 
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Biological Weakness
Description: As a Bonus Action you can make an Intelligence (nature) check about a creature you can see (DC=10+the creatures CR). On a success a 19 is also considered a critical hit against this creature for the next minute and you expend a use. On a failure nothing happens. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Desiccating Breath
Description:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that fails its saving throw is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage.

Name: Topaz Rest
Description: During a short rest, the area around you dries up. Any creature that enters the 300 foot emination must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save they gain 1 level of exhaustion. Creatures that are immune or resistant to necrotic damage automatically succeed on this saving throw. The exhaustion ends as soon as they move further than 300 feet away from you. You may also end the effect on a creature at will. This effect ends when you leave the terrain type you spent your rest in.

Name: Psionic Fighting Expert
Description: If you have advantage on the attack roll and you hit, you may deal an additional 1d4 damage. The damage type of this extra damage can either be force, thunder, psychic, necrotic or radiant (choose when you pick this trait).

Name: Improved Telepathic Link
Description: As an action, you can psionically link yourself to a willing creature you share a language with. For the next hour, you can mentally communicate with them as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

Name: Extended Gem Flight
Description: You may now use your Gem Flight ability twice per long rest.

Name: Dragon Wings
Description: Your flying speed while using Gem Flight increases by 30 feet.

Name: Dragon Tortle
Description: You gain the Breath Weapon feature from the Gem Dragonborn, but you may only use it a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded up. The damage type used is the same as the one you picked for Gem Shell Resilience. You also count as this type of dragonborn for the purpose of choosing Orenth traits.

Name: Infused Gem Lair
Description:
As a gem kobold you gain certain advantages while in Gem Dragon lairs or areas of high Orenth influence. Depending on the gem type you gain one of the following effects: 

Amethyst: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and you can hover.
Sapphire: You gain a burrow speed equal to your walking speed. This burrow speed allows you to burrow through solid rock.
Emerald: You constantly sense magic around you, as per the Detect Magic spell.
Topaz: You start every turn with a number of temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
Crystal: You gain a portent die whenever you roll initiative. You lose this die when combat ends.
Jade: You can become invisible as an action. Your invisibility ends when you use the Attack or Magic action.

Name: Shaped Breath Weapon
Description: The size of your breath weapon increases to a 30 foot cone. Additionally whenever you use your breath weapon you may choose to exhale in a 60 foot long, 5 foot wide line instead.

Name: Extreme Exertion
Description: Before you attempt an ability check you may force your body to exert itself beyond its normal limits. You may choose a d4, d6, d8, d10 or d12 and add the result to your ability check. Your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the value rolled with the extra die. The reduction lasts until you fishish a short rest, during which you must be unconscious. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Imbued weapon
Description: As a bonus action you can instill your own {@table Martial abilities|oreorenth} into one of your weapons. Any creature using the weapon can use your ability as if they were you for the next minute. You may use this trait once per long rest.

Name: In Tune with Stone
Description: Your connection to the earth allows you to sense people around you. You gain tremorsense to a range of 10 feet.

Name: Besieger
Description: You deal double damage against objects, structures and constructs.

Name: Constrict
Description: You can grapple a creature even if your hands aren't free.

Name: Hydra Heads
Description: Once per long rest when you take damage equal to three times your level over the course of a single round you channel the power of a hydra. You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level and while these remain you can make an additional weapon attack on each of your turns and you can take two reactions during a round.

Name: Close Quarters Combat
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Light and Finnesse Property, or your Unarmed Strikes. When you successfully grapple a creature or escape a grapple, you may make a single attack with your weapon or unarmed strike as a bonus action. Additionally, whenever a creature fails to escape a grapple with you, you may make a single attack with your weapon or unarmed strike as a reaction.

Name: Flex
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with and that has the Versatile Property. When you hit with a melee attack using this weapon, you deal its Versatile damage even if you’re wielding it with one hand.

Name: Sap
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has no properties, or your Unarmed Strike. If you hit a creature with this weapon or your unarmed strike, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

Name: Slow
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with or your Unarmed Strike. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If you hit the creature more than once with this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

Name: Strangle
Description:
Choose a weapon with a string or chain (Flail, shortbow, sling, whip, longbow) or your Unarmed Strike. While wielding this weapon, you may attempt to grapple a creature (no more than one size larger than you) by looping the chain or rope of your weapon around its neck. While grappled in this way, the creature cannot speak, cannot breathe, and has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you surprised the creature with this grapple, it cannot hold its breath and immediately begins suffocating.
Creatures that you cannot grapple or do not need to breathe are unaffected.
If a creature has a Breath weapon or similar damage dealing ability, the amount of dice its breath weapon deals goes down by one whenever it starts its turn being strangled. Its breath weapon goes back to normal when it is no longer being strangled.

Name: Lock Blades
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Versatile property. When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you while you are wielding this weapon, you may use your reaction to attempt to lock blades and parry their attack. Make an attack roll with your weapon. You have advantage on this roll if you are wielding your weapon with two hands. If the result of this roll equals or exceeds their attack roll, their attack misses.

Name: Cleave
Description:
Choose a melee weapon you have proficiency with that has the heavy property. 
If you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, you can make an attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage, unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Push
Description: Whenever you push a creature with your Push Orenth Trait, you may also push any creature within 10 feet of them.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Cleave
Description: You may attack up to 2 creatures within reach whenever you use your Cleave Orenth trait.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Fearsome Accuracy
Description: You can use your Fearsome Accuracy Orenth Trait while the target is anywhere in your long range.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Grinding Halt
Description: While wielding the weapon that your Grinding Halt Orenth Trait applies to you cannot be moved against your will. Whenever someone attempts to move you against your will, you can use your reaction to move them in the opposite direction instead.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Lock Blades.
Description: Whenever you use your Lock Blades Orenth trait and you beat the attack roll by more than 5 you do not use your reaction.

Name: Weapon Lord
Description: After a Long Rest you may change out one of your Orenth Traits that has the Weapon Mastery Subtype for a different Orenth Trait that has the Weapon Mastery Subtype.

Name: Weapon Training
Description: As a downtime activity, you can attempt to master more weapons. With this Orenth trait you can gain access to more Ingens Orenth traits with the Weapon Mastery subtype and the Exclusive prerequisite. The way to train a new mastery follows the Training Downtime Activity from Xanathar's guide, but the time it takes to get this new Orenth trait is a number of workweeks equal to (10-minus your choice of your Constitution, Strength or Dexterity modifier)*10. You must already have an Exclusive Orenth Trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype of this tier in order to get access to a new one. Once you have gained a new weapon mastery you may only change it to a different Exclusive Weapon Mastery Orenth trait whenever you may change Orenth traits and you must always have a second Exclusive Weapon Mastery Orenth trait of this tier.

Name: Innately Fast Reactions
Description: Initiative now counts as a skill for you. You may gain proficiency or expertise in it away from another skill when you pick this orenth trait.

Name: Resourceful Weapon Master
Description: You can put any weapon mastery on any weapon, even if they don't meet the requirements. When you pick this trait you may swap the weapon any of your weapon masteries apply to.

Name: Jabber
Description: Choose a weapon that you are proficient in that has the Finesse or the Light property. When you ready an attack or make an opportunity attack with this weapon you may use your Extra Attack feature as a reaction.

Name: Mythical Weapons
Prerequisite: An Exclusive Weapon Mastery Orenth Trait
Description: Choose a weapon that has an Exclusive Weapon Mastery Orenth trait applied to it. Whenever you deal bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage with this weapon you may deal force damage instead.

Name: Bloody Wound
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the light and finesse properties. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack you may choose to deal no weapon damage, but give them a Bloody Wound instead. While the creature has the Bloody Wound they take 1d4 slashing damage at the start of each of their turns, until they use an action to make a DC 10 Wisdom (Medicine) check or regain any hit points. A creature can have only one Bloody Wound at a time.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Crushing Blow
Description: You can make the attack as part of your attack action instead of as an action.

Name: Repel Charge
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy, Two-Handed and Reach properties. Whenever a creature moves at least 15 feet straight towards you into your reach, you may use your reaction to make a weapon attack against the creature. On a hit they must also make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + prof. bonus + your Strength modifier) or be pushed away 15 feet if they are no more than one size larger than you.

Name: Weapon Masterd: Repel Charge
Description: Whenever you hit with your Repel Charge attack you may treat the attack as a critical hit.

Name: Broken Weapon and Bones
Description: Choose a simple or improvised melee weapon that you have proficiency with that deals bludgeoning damage. As an action you can choose to make a single weapon attack. If you hit the creature it is considered a critical hit. Whenever you do so, your weapon breaks.

Name: Weapon Mastered: Broken Weapon and Bones
Description: You can make the attack as part of your attack action instead of as an action.

Name: The Indomitable Human Spirit
Description: You gain the ability to share your hope with others. You can now grant a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus a point of inspiration which lasts until you finish a long rest or you use it.

Name: Human Adaptibility
Description: Your ability to adapt to the world around you has begun to manifest itself within your own connection to the world. When you finish a short rest, you can switch out one of your Orenth Traits. After the switch, your other Orenth traits should still fulfil their original requirements. You cannot switch out this trait using this feature. For example, when you have a Tier 1 Fey Orenth and a Tier 2 Fey Orenth you cannot switch the tier 1 Fey Orenth for a different Orenth.

Name: Extremely Stubborn
Description: You gain the stubborn orenth trait.

Name: Brass Rest
Description: While you are resting an aura of friendlyness eminates around you. Any humanoid that comes into a 300 foot emination around must make a Wisom save (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failure they become charmed by you and any creature of your choice. While charmed in this way they are inclined to overshare and have interesting conversations. If you or your allies attack the charmed creature or an ally of the charmed creature they can repeat their saving throw. Any creatures of your choice are immune to this effect. The charm ends as soon as they move out of the emination. The emination ends if you start another short rest or leave the tarrain type that you spent your rest in.

Name: Blue Dragon Adversary
Description: You gain resistance to Lightning damage and advantage on saving throws made against effects that deal lightning damage. Additionally you have advantage on saving throws imposed by Blue Dragons.

Name: Thorny Friends
Description: You can speak with cacti and desert animals.

Name: Bronze Rest
Description: While resting you protect yourself and those around you. Any creature of your choice within 300 feet of where you spend your short rest gains a Bronze Inspiration die. The die is a 1d4 when you are level 1, and increases in size each time your proficiency bonus increases. This die can be added to any saving throw. The Bronze Inspiration die lasts for 24 hours after the creature leaves the area you spent the short rest in.

Name: John Wick
Prerequisite: A mount or a summoned creature.
Description: After your mount or summon is reduced to 0 hit points you gain the following benefits for the next minute: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. Once after you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you can force any creature within 30 feet of you to make a wisdom save (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus+your Constitution modifier) or become frightened of you for the next minute. They can repeat their saving throw at the end of their turns. You can get these benefits once per long rest.

Name: Proficient in Protection
Description: Whenever you gain expertise in a skill you may choose to gain proficiency in a saving throw instead.

Name: Copper Rest
Description: Your presence inspires those that rest alongside you. Any creature of your choice within 300 feet of where you spend your short rest gains a Copper Inspiration die. The die is a 1d4 when you are level 1, and increases in size each time your proficiency bonus increases. This die can be added to any ability check. The Copper Inspiration die lasts for 24 hours after the creature leaves the area you spent the short rest in.

Name: Unfunne Man
Description: Whenever you make a pun you can give any creature that cringed or groaned psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest. You can still make puns even if you have no more uses remaining.

Name: Golden Rest
Description: Your goodness emanates from you while you rest. Any elemental and avil aligned creature in a 300 foot emination have their maximum hit points lowered by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier. As soon as the creature leaves the emination the reduction ends. The emination dissapears if you leave the terrain type you had your rest in or you start a new short rest.

Name: Moonstone Rest
Prerequisite: No other Rest Traits and a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait
Description: When you start your rest, so does the world around you. Any creature that comes within 300 feet of where you are taking your short rest must make a Wisdom saving throw  (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a failed save they fall unconscious until your rest ends. Creatures that have immunity to magical sleep or do not need to sleep are not affected. The effect ends an hour after you leave the area.

Name: Shiny Scales
Description: Whenever you take radiant damage you can use your reaction to reflect it back towards your attacker. You take no damage and instead for the attacker to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier). On a failed save they take the radiant damage instead. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Focused Healing
Description: As a reaction to an ability that restores hit points being cast within 60 feet of you, you may make a Charisma (Medicine) check (DC=10+twice the amount of dice that would be healed). On a success you can heal the maximum amount of each die instead of rolling.

Name: Silver Rest
Description: Your presence heals those that rest alongside you. The hit point maximum of any creature of your choice within 300 feet of where you spend your short rest increases by your Charisma modifier. The increase lasts until they finish a short rest without you.

Name: Bronze Duelling
Description: You get the benefits of the {@optfeature Deflective Weapons|ingensorenth} Orenth Trait with the following changes: The die is a d6 instead of a d4. Additionally, whenever you use the feature you also gain temporary hit points equal to the number rolled on the d6.

Name: Metallic Fighting Expert
Description: If you have advantage on the attack roll and you hit, you may deal an additional 1d4 damage. The damage type of this extra damage can either be radiant, fire, lightning, acid or cold (choose when you pick this trait).

Name: Bane of Evil
Description: You gain the benefits of the {@optfeature Fearsome Accuracy|ingensorenth} Orenth trait. Any creature that has an evil alignment has disadvantage on the saving throw.

Name: Defence is the best Offence
Description: You gain the benefits of the {@optfeature Deflective Weapons|ingensorenth} Orenth trait. Additionally, the next time you hit the creature that attacked you, you may deal additional damage equal to the die you rolled to deflect the attack.

Name: Bronze Shield
Description: You gain the benefits of the {@optfeature Deflective Weapons|ingensorenth} Orenth trait. Additionally, you may also use the ability on a creature within 5 feet of you when they are attacked, possibly shielding them.

Name: Legendary Warrior
Description: Whenever a creature uses a legendary action, you may use your reaction make a single weapon attack.

Name: Enhanced Celestial Revelation
Description: You may now use your revelation twice per long rest.

Name: Hands of Superior Healing
Description: You may roll d8s instead of d6s whenever you use your Healing Hands ability. Additionally you can use this trait once per short rest instead of once per long rest.

Name: Movement of the Moons
Prerequisite: Access to Chromatic, Metallic and Gem Orenth
Description: Whenever you finish a Short rest you may change any Chromatic, Metallic or Gem Orenth trait you have. They must still be Chromatic, Metallic or Gem Orenth traits.

Name: General Worshipper
Description: Whenever you gain enough piety to get a new feature with Bahamut, Tiamat or Sardior, you may pick a feature from a different church, cult or school than the one you are following, but it must still be from the same diety.

Name: Brass Winds
Description: On your turn you may forgo using your movement to move and instead move a willing creature up to your movement in a straight line in a direction of your choice. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest

Name: Altered Schools
Description: When you finish a long rest choose a spell that you can cast, you can change the spell school of this spell to another.

Name: Hit point Permanency
Description: Choose a spell that you can cast that gives a creature temporary hit points. Temporary hit points from other sources may stack with the temporary hit points from the spell you cast. You decide which source of temporary hit points gets depleted first.

Name: Martial Mentor
Description: You can take the help action as a bonus action when helping a creature that is wielding a weapon that your weapon mastery can apply to.

Name: Generalized Mastery
Description: Any weapon mastery trait you have applies to all weapons that meet the prerequisites for it. A weapon cannot have more than 1 trait applied to it at a time, even if other Orenth traits would allow this.

Name: Blessed
Description: Whenever you finish a long rest you can choose one blessing that recharges. Discuss with your DM whenever you get a blessing or a blessing-like ability.

Name: Sunrise
Description: You have advantage on saving throws made against being blinded and you gain resistance against radiant damage.

Name: Handfasting
Description:
You bind yourself to another person. This other person must also have this trait. Whenever you finish a short rest together you may pick one of the following benefits: 
Your maximum hp increased by your partners level. 
You gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws. 
You can add 1d4 to any Wisdom, Intelligence or Charisma ability check made while the other person is within 10 feet of you.

Name: Spiritual Connection
Description: Once per night you may cast Speak with Dead.

Name: Focused Breath
Description: You have learned to focus your breath into a single deadly burst. You may spend multiple uses of your breath weapon at once. Any creature hit by this combined breath must make a single saving throw and takes the damage of all breaths combined on a failure, or half on a success.

Name: Arcane Flexibility
Description: Over the course of a long rest you may change one of your Orenth traits with the Spell Mastery or Spell Recovery subtype to another trait with this subtype.

Name: Potent Recovery
Description: Choose a tier 1 Orenth trait that gives you a first level spellslot back. You may instead get a second level spellslot back. The orenth type of this trait is the same as the tier 1 trait you choose. You cannot choose the same tier 1 trait in this way twice.

Name: Pure Casting
Description: Choose a levelled spell that requires a saving throw. Whenever you cast this spell on a creature they must use their ability score for the save instead, instead of any saving throw proficiency they might have.

Name: Consistent Casting
Description: Choose a spell that requires a spell attack roll. Whenever you have disadvantage on your spell attack with this spell, you instead roll normally.

Name: Consensual Casting
Description: Choose a spell with a range of self. The range of this spell is now touch.

Name: Lingering Spell
Description: Choose a spell that requires concentration. Whenever your concentration on this spell ends, it lasts until the end of your next turn.

Name: Peekaboo
Description: You may hide as a bonus action while you're obscured only by a creature one size larger than you.

Name: Fastball Special
Description: While standing next to an ally with a Strength of 15 or greater they can use their reaction to throw you up to 30 feet.

Name: Half luck, Half skill
Description: Whenever you reroll a 1 on a d20 check using Lucky you may still gain inspiration while using the new roll.

Name: Where did that come from
Description: If you make an attack roll while hidden and miss, you don't loose the Hidden condition until the end of your turn.

Name: Long Limbed Spellcasting
Description: Whenever you cast a spell with a range of touch on your turn, the range becomes 15 feet.

Name: Transmuted Arms
Description: Once on each of your turns when you make a melee attack you may increase your range by 30 feet.

Name: Lucky I prepared that!
Description: Whenever you finish a long rest you may forgo one of your spell preparations. At any point you may then as a reaction you may then choose any spell from your spell list(s) as long as you have the spell slots of the level and prepare it, until your next long rest you have access to this spell and cast it as normal.

Name: Fiersome Natural Weapons
Description: You may apply one of the following traits to your natural weapons: Light and Finesse.

Name: Bahamut's Chosen
Description: You have advantage on Charisma checks made to interact with creatures that have Metallic Orenth. You also have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks made to interact with creatures that have Chromatic Orenth.

Name: Eyes of Bahamut
Description: Whenever you use your Celestial Revelation trait you also gain Truesight with a range 30 feet for the next minute.

Name: Protective Mount
Description: Medium creatures may use you as a mount. Additionally, any creature that uses you as a mount may add your Charisma modifier to any saving throw they make.

Name: Manouvarable Mount
Description: Medium creatures may use you as a mount. Additionally, the creature mounting you may forgo using their movement on their turn, allowing you to move up to your speed as a reaction.

Name: Perfect Camouflage
Description: Whenever you successfully hide in rocky terrain, fully exposing yourself to a person doesn't end the hide condition as long as you are within 5 feet of a stone surface.

Name: Fairy Psionics
Description: Whenever you finish a long rest you may replace any spell you have access to through Fairy Magic with an enchantment spell of the same level of your choice.

Name: Time Enchantments
Description: Whenever a creature fails a saving throw against an enchantment spell within 30 feet of you, you may use your reaction to roll on the {@table Messed Up Time Table|oreorenth}, applying the effect to them until the spell cast on them ends. You may use this feature once per Long rest.

Name: Fey Bargain: Pyromancer
Description: Whenever you hit with a weapon attack you deal an additional 1d4 fire damage. However, you also gain vulnerability to cold damage.

Name: Molten Breath
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals fire damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your Breath weapon. Additionally, whenever you use your breath weapon you leave a trail of melting ground behind. For the next round, any creature that enters the breath’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 1d10 fire damage.

Name: Combustion Breath
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally whenever a creature fails their saving throw against your breath weapon they combust in flame. At the start of each of its turns the target takes 1d10 fire damage. The target must then make a Dexterity saving throw, on a successful save, the effect ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the Effect ends.

Name: Corrosive Breath
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals acid damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, the armor class of a creature decreases by 1 whenever they fail their saving throw against your breath. Their armor class returns to normal after a Short Rest.

Name: I was never here
Description: Whenever you leave after meeting a person you may make a deception check against their passive insight. On a success they forget your name and what you look like. You may use this ability once per short rest, if you fail you don't expend a use.

Name: Power from the Shield
Description: At the start of your turn you gain temporary hit points equal to your AC-10-your Dexterity modifier. You may get these temporary hit points a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier every long rest.

Name: Tortoise
Description: Whenever you retreat into your shell you may still use your action to do one of the following things: Make a single unarmed strike, move up to your walking speed, make a skill check. However, your swimming speed is reduced by 10 feet even outside your shell.

Name: Gelatinous Spirit
Description: A spectral gelatinous cube forms around you. People may only move through your space if you allow them to. As a bonus action you may increase the size of the cube to 10 by 10 feet for the next minute. You may use this bonus action a number of times equal to your constitution modifier.

Name: Skin Shedding
Description: After you finish a short rest you may shed your skin. For the next 24 hours the following effects apply to you: You gain vulnerability to fire damage. You may roll one hit die and add your consitution modifier and increase your hp maximum by this amount. You are considered large for the purposes of grappling, carrying, pushing and lifting.

Name: Freezing Breath
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals cold damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever you use your breath weapon it leaves a trail of icy ground. For the next minute, any creature that enters the breath’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there needs to make a dexterity save against your breath DC. On a failure they fall prone.

Name: Kobold Craftiness
Description:
Over the course of a short rest you may gather materials to craft an item worth no more 2 gold pieces. You craft an item that can emulate the effects of a tier 1 and 2 Orenth trait related to the area you're resting in. Only you can use the item and it breaks after 24 hours or when you make a new one. You can also create an attachment to something you already have on you, such as a weapon or armor. 
You can only pick an Orenth trait that can be used once per long rest, once per long rest. Whenever you pick a trait that can be used multiple times every long rest you may use it once.

Name: Unstable Creations
Description: Whenever you create an item with your Kobold Craftiness trait you may choose a thematically appropriate cantrip and first level spell. You may cast these spells using your Wisdom (chromatic), Charisma (Metallic) or Intelligence (Gem) as its spellcasting ability, depending on your colour. Once you cast the first level spell your item is destroyed.

Name: Magical and Unstable Weapon
Description: Whenever you make a weapon (attachment) with this trait it becomes a +1 magical weapon, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to those rolls. Whenever you roll a natural 1 on an attack roll with it roll a d6. If you roll a value higher than your proficiency bonus the weapon (attachment) immediately breaks.

Name: Home Sweet Home
Description: Whenever you craft an item in an area with the same Orenth type as your kobold heritage you may emulate a tier 2 and a tier 3 trait instead.

Name: Alseid
Description: You gain resistance against radiant damage. Additionally you learn the Goodberry spell and you may cast it once per long rest using your Charisma as your spellcasting ability. When you do so, the goodberries take the shape of a fruit of your choice.

Name: Plant Sprint
Description: While moving across plant covered terrain, such as grasslands, climbing up a tree or navigating through a thick jungle, your speed increases by 10 feet.

Name: Brass Enemies
Description: You have advantage on saving throws inposed by brass dragons, dragonborn and kobolds. Additionally you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling unconscious and if you fall unconscious after failing a saving throw you may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns ending the effect on a success.

Name: Homegrown Weapons
Description: Your body can grow its own weapons. Over the course of a long rest you may grow a wooden club, greatclub, quarterstaff or maul. Once you've grown your weapon, you may also pick one tier 2 orenth trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype and apply it to the weapon until you grow a new one.

Name: Phototropism
Description: Whenever you start your turn in sunlight you become enlarged according to the Enlarge/Reduce spell. The effect ends as soon as you start your turn outside of sunlight.

Name: Poisonous Spines
Description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your cactus spike you may deal an additional 1d4 poison damage to them.

Name: Shock Resistance
Description: You gain advantage on saving throws made to avoid the paralyzed and stunned condition

Name: Explosive Flames
Description: Whenever you cast your produce flame cantrip and you hurl your flame at a creature, you also deal 1d4 fire damage to any creature within 5 feet of them on a hit.

Name: Shocking Leaps
Description: You can move up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attaacks from the target of cantrip, as a part of casting this cantrip.

Name: Burst of Vines
Description: The range of your Thorn Whip cantrip increases to 60 feet. Additionally, you may create a number of whips equal to the number of damage dice you could deal, making an attack roll for each of them seperatly. Each of these whips deals 1d6 piercing damage.

Name: Acid Wave
Description: Whenever you cast your Acid Splash cantrip you create a 10 foot radius sphere instead.

Name: Powerful Gusts
Description: You learn the Gust cantrip and you use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Whenever you cast this cantrip you may target a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus.

Name: Explosive Bursts
Prerequisite: Elemental Chaos or Mark of Tiamat Orenth
Description: You learn the Sorcerous Burst cantrip. Whenever you cast this spell it deals 1d6+2 damage instead. If you roll an 6 on a d6 for this spell, you can roll another 1d6+2, and add it to the damage. When you cast this spell, the maximum number of these d6s you can add to the spell's damage equals your spellcasting ability modifier.

Name: Spore Spray
Description: Whenever you cast your Poison Spray cantrip, you may choose to deal psychic damage instead.

Name: Blade Moat
Description: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against an ally within 5 feet of you while you are concentrating on blade ward, you may use your reaction to subtract 1d4 from the attack roll.
